Text.Value: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another of Mystic Carrion's runaways.*
She hides in the ground, but I will find her.

EditorData.NodeContext: No awareness that this means they are dead. Playful, almost gleeful - thinks he's about to win.

Text.Value: 'Down the stairs, across the sand. Down the stairs, across the sand...'

EditorData.NodeContext: Sing song, amusing himself

Text.Value: No, no. You're cheating! I have to hide!
No... no, she is just good at keeping still.
Sister was always good at hiding. But I'll find her this time.

EditorData.logicalname: HASMET MORBUS CONVO DONE, NO CARRION QUEST

Text.Value: I can? That's good, because I like you. You're nice, like Thrumbo.

EditorData.NodeContext: Utterly trusting of the player, really sweet

Text.Value: Sister might need a wash though. She is hiding from me, in the ground over there.
The divine tugs at you. Give in, letting your god flow through you.
*You recall where you've smelled this beggar's rotten musk before - in Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of the runaways he seeks.*
*Your divine power focuses on the beggar - revealing the magic that sustains him. This man is a corpse - a zombie.*
You were playing, too? You must be nice, like Thrumbo.

EditorData.NodeContext: Absolutely believes you, a bit dissapointed but will be over it by the next line

Text.Value: It's too late for that. I already caught you. The game's over.
Come now - we're friends, aren't we? You can trust me.
'Down the stairs, across the sand. Down the stairs, across the sand.'

EditorData.NodeContext: Repeating something he's worked very hard to memorise, stressed out by being put under pressure

Text.Value: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another zombie.*
All I remember is, 'Down the stairs, across the sand. Down the stairs, across the sand.'

EditorData.NodeContext: 'Down the stairs, across the sand' with a sing-song rhythm/tune - it's a memory aid, supposed to have helped him escape.

Text.Value: I don't like this game. Leave me alone!

EditorData.NodeContext: Scared, panicking - about to run away

Text.Value: NO. I am clean. I take good care of myself, like sister taught me.
Very sensible. Don't tell anyone anything.
Mother and father hide in the ground with her.
Some people covered her in dirt. But I will find her again.

EditorData.NodeContext: Playful, like he knows a secret

Text.Value: If I were her, I'd be hiding, too. You smell terrible up close.
When I find sister, I will ask her if you can join our game. She's the oldest.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'She's the oldest' as though this explains why it isn't his decision.

Text.Value: Will Thrumbo come and play with me soon?

EditorData.NodeContext: Full of childish hope

Text.Value: *Beneath his ragged clothing, you catch a glimpse of rotten flesh - more than any living being could sustain. This man is a zombie.*
You poor creature. I'll not hurt your friend - I swear on all I hold sacred.
Have you no one else? No other family?
You aren't very nice. But I am. So you can stay.

EditorData.NodeContext: A child who's been told to play nicely

Text.Value: I'm sorry, but your sister is gone. Best let her rest in peace.
I can't leave her out here alone.

EditorData.NodeContext: "What a silly suggestion"

Text.Value: Thrumbo said not - not to tell anyone where we went...

EditorData.NodeContext: Very uncertain - naturally trusting, so this instruction is hard for him to understand

Text.Value: I hope I find them soon. I like this game, but it is less fun to play it alone.

EditorData.NodeContext: Aware of his sadness, but not quite able to realise that they aren't coming back.

Text.Value: We're playing Rivington rules, remember? Which means Thrumbo won, and I have to go congratulate him.
In the ground, over there.
You're a bit old for hide and seek, aren't you?
If she's in the ground, that means she's dead.
He told me what to do, but he said it very quickly. I didn't understand.
Look closer. Try to identify the cause of the smell.
I will get a bedroom of my own now. I can keep lovely things in it, for when sister can visit.
*An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form, the same that tainted Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of his runaway servants.*
She is the best at this game. I never win, except when she lets me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Proud of his sister's skills, not bothered that she lets him win - it makes him love here even more

Text.Value: I'll cut your head off and offer up your desiccated husk, unless you tell me where he is.
Sister was always good at hiding. But I'll find her this time.
Sister is older than me. She always likes to play.
Your sister is no more - her soul has left this plane. Do you understand?
Your sister is food for the worms, and her soul twists in agony as we speak. She's dead.
*You try to focus on the beggar, but the smell is too strong, too nauseating. Perhaps the cause is better left unknown.*
*An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form. The smell of rot. The smell of death.*
I won't! I'll hide where no one will find me.

EditorData.NodeContext: eager to please

Text.Value: Brother Thrumbo said you saved us. You are welcome to play here any time.
Undead defy the natural order - tell me, or I'll correct the mistake that is your existence.
Do you know where she's hiding?
I'll not hurt Thrumbo - I swear it. You can trust me.
No, not him. He isn't allowed to play. Thrumbo said he can't find us.
Attack.
Is your sister a zombie, too?
Sister always hides from me. She likes to play.

EditorData.NodeContext: Explaining to the player, as if they asked

Text.Value: Mystic Carrion is looking for you. He sent me.
Thrumbo's not here to protect you, is he? So tell me. NOW!
Leave.
Come out, sister - I will find you!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Morbus calls out to his sister (not present - he's actually standing near her grave)
EditorData.NodeContext: Playful, calling out as though playing hide and seek

Text.Value: I don't know! He explained, but I didn't understand...

EditorData.NodeContext: Scared, panicking

Text.Value: I'm playing hide and seek with Thrumbo. Can you help me find him?
Your sister is no more - her soul has left this plane. If you like, we could pray for her?
No. No! Leave me alone!

EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant

Text.Value: A zombie? Are you playing with me?

EditorData.NodeContext: Not lying to you. He genuinely believes this is part of a game

Text.Value: Sniff the area, expanding your senses. Try to identify the smell.
Sister is always happy to see me - she told me so. She will smile so much when I find her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Happy in thoughts of his sister

Synopsis: Dialog for one of the zombie beggars. After player talks to Father Carrion and has been tasked to kill them, they will react to this and either run to warn their leader, Thrumbo, or confront player. The following states are one-liners and hasmets for each possible quest state (meeting with thrumbo, outside house and inside father carrion's house once fully killed.)
